section: MAP – VERTICAL WEATHER Vertical weather allows the radar azimuth beams to perform ground clutter suppression and to perform a preliminary assessment of weather threats in range, azimuth, and altitude. This data is stored in memory and retrieved from the memory system in a variety of cut sets. The vertical data is extracted along any desired vertical path, i.e. along the current track, unwound Flight Management System (FMS) ﬂight plan, or along a crew commanded azimuth angle and displayed on the Vertical Situation Display (VSD) format.
